title: Henriette Muller 1996 Memories Of A Swan Song
description: Henriette Muller ~ Memories Of A Swan Song ~ 1996 Konnex Records KCD 5072. http://i5.imageban.ru/out/2017/07/22/0b77d096730e705bd446383e2b43504e.jpg 1. Searching For A Place To Be 4:51 2. Memories Of A Swan Song 7:11 3. Crazy Cradle 4:52 4. West 25th Street 5:04 5. Back Home Where It's Quiet 7:43 6. Harmonic Dance 4:52 7. Will You Kiss And Smile 3:56 8. Floating 5:02 9. A Weekend Alone 3:47 10. Reggamania 3:18 11. Sweet Seconds 5:20 Henriette Muller: tenor and soprano saxophone Peter Herbert: bass (except 11) Jeff Brillinger: drums (except 11) David Berkman: piano (4,5,8,9) Steve Davis: drums (11) Muller is blessed with something rare - an individual voice. On both soprano and tenor, she explores deep chasms of sound and abstract melody. on “Crazy Cradle”, for example, Muller uses the percussive head as a base from which to sway the melody from side to side, never quite settling for the obvious. On “Searching For a Place To Be”, she plays a simple but gorgeous melody that drifts over the rolling rhythms of bassist Peter Herbert and drummer Jeff Brillinger. The resulting effect is truly trance-inducing and quietly intense...this is a stunning debut. - Russ Summers, Option 70, Sept./Oct. 1996
